Package game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The computer game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Initialise a new Game.

    • Method Detail

      • goToNextLevel

        public void goToNextLevel()
        Take the game to the next level. The previous health of the soldier is carried on and the controller and mouse listeners are set the new level bodies. Method is typically called when the previous level is completed.

      • displayLeaderBoard

        public void displayLeaderBoard()
        Displays the leader board on the left side. If there are no entries, the pane won't be displayed at all.

      • restartLevel

        public void restartLevel()
        Restarts the current level. The health of the solider is set to the one in the beginning of the level. Typically called when the "Reset" button is pressed in the control panel.

      • goToLevel

        public void goToLevel​(GameLevel levelToGoTo)
        Goes to the level specified. Typically called when loading a saved game.
        Parameters:
        levelToGoTo - game level to go to

      • setBackgroundMusic

        public void setBackgroundMusic​(java.lang.String filePath)
        Changes the background music. Typically used when progressing from one level to another or in response to game events.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the filepath where the new sound is located.

      • changeVolume

        public void changeVolume​(double newVolume)
        Sets the volume of the current background music. Called when the volume slider is used or the mute check box.
        Parameters:
        newVolume - the new volume of the sound.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the game, background music and stopwatch. Typically called when the "pause" button is pressed in the control panel. The game state is set to "paused" and a "PAUSED" string is displayed in the center of the window.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the game, the background music and stopwatch. Usually called when pressing the "resume" button in the control panel. Game state is set to "play".

      • setCurrentPlayerName

        public void setCurrentPlayerName​(java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
        Changes the name of the user. Called when a new user enters their name or a save file is loaded and the name from the text file is loaded to currentPlayerName. The left panel that shows instructions and takes the name of the user is also removed. This prevents the user from entering a second name or changing it when a save file is loaded.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerName - the new name of the user playing.

      • getCurrentPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getCurrentPlayerName()
        Returns the name given at the start of the game or loaded from a save file.
        Returns:
        the name of the user.

      • getWorld

        public GameLevel getWorld()
        Returns the current level the world is at. Used when saving the level the user is playing to a text file.
        Returns:
        the GameLevel the world is displaying.

      • getCurrentLevel

        public int getCurrentLevel()
        Returns the integer value of the current level. Usually used to display instructions to the user at certain levels.
        Returns:
        integer of the current level number.

      • setGameState

        public void setGameState​(java.lang.String gameState)
        Changes the state of the game. This is called when the game is either paused or resumed. Useful when displaying "paused" when the game is paused and also removing that message from the window.
        Parameters:
        gameState - the current state of the game.

      • getGameState

        public java.lang.String getGameState()
        Returns the current state of the game.
        Returns:
        the state of the game

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Run the game.
